bestBHT.bht: The fruit produced by a tree determines its true character, just like a bramble would never bear grapes. The word cluster of grapes is associated with the bush from which God spoke to Moses, highlighting the significance of these fruits. Actions and deeds are the ultimate test, and by their fruits, individuals can be known. This also applies to preachers, as their doctrines should align with the word of God, producing good works and fruits of righteousness, which are evidence of grace.

Marvin Vincent: A farmer could never make a bramble bear grapes.
It is the word employed by the Septuagint for the bush out of which God spoke to Moses.
Archibald T. Robertson: The fruit of each tree reveals its actual character. It is the final test.
By their fruits ye shall know them.
A verb common in Greek writers for gathering ripe fruit.
John Gill: Good and bad preachers are known by their doctrines, the one being agreeable, the other disagreeable to the word of God.
A holy life is the fruit of grace, and an evidence of it.
No more can an unregenerate man perform good works, or bring forth fruits of righteousness acceptable unto God.

bhtAttempts.bht: By their fruits, the true character of individuals can be discerned. Just as a farmer would not expect a bramble to bear grapes, the fruit produced reveals the nature of the tree itself. This concept is emphasized in the usage of the word cluster of grapes, which is also associated with the bush from which God spoke to Moses. The gathering of ripe fruit, a common verb in Greek literature, further reinforces the idea that actions and deeds are the ultimate test. Therefore, it is through the evidence of a holy life, aligned with the word of God, that one can differentiate between good and bad preachers and determine the quality of their doctrines. The ability to produce good works and fruits of righteousness is a result of grace, which is not attainable by the unregenerate.

The character of individuals is revealed by the fruit they bear. Just as a farmer can't expect grapes from a bramble, the type of fruit produced is a test of the tree's true nature. The usage of cluster of grapes brings to mind the bush from which God spoke to Moses. The gathering of ripe fruit shows the importance of actions and deeds. It is through a holy life aligned with God's word that one can discern good and bad preachers and their doctrines, as good works and fruits of righteousness are evidence of grace.

The fruit produced by a tree determines its true character, just like a bramble would never bear grapes. The word cluster of grapes is associated with the bush from which God spoke to Moses, highlighting the significance of these fruits. Actions and deeds are the ultimate test, and by their fruits, individuals can be known. This also applies to preachers, as their doctrines should align with the word of God, producing good works and fruits of righteousness, which are evidence of grace.

The true nature of individuals is revealed by the fruit they bear, just as a farmer cannot expect grapes from a bramble. Genuine character is tested and known through the fruit produced. The term cluster of grapes evokes the image of God speaking to Moses from a bush, underscoring the significance of these fruits. The gathering of ripe fruit signifies the importance of actions and deeds. It is through a holy life that aligns with God's word that one can distinguish between good and bad preachers, as good works and fruits of righteousness serve as evidence of grace.

The fruit produced is the ultimate indicator of the true character of individuals, just as a farmer cannot expect grapes from a bramble. The term cluster of grapes is reminiscent of the bush through which God spoke to Moses, emphasizing the importance of these fruits. The gathering of ripe fruit highlights the significance of actions and deeds in determining one's nature. By living a holy life that aligns with God's word, one can discern between good and bad preachers, as good works and fruits of righteousness provide evidence of grace.
